edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.damgardJurikKnowledge

Class SigmaDJKnowledgeProverInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.damgardJurikKnowledge.SigmaDJKnowledgeProverInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SigmaProverInput, ZKProverInput

    public class SigmaDJKnowledgeProverInput
extends java.lang.Object
implements SigmaProverInput
    Concrete implementation of SigmaProtocol input, used by the SigmaDJProduct2ProverComputation. This protocol is used for a party to prove that 3 ciphertexts c1,c2,c3 are encryptions of values x1,x2,x3 s.t. x1*x2=x3 mod N. The prover knows the plaintext and randomness of the second plaintext, and the randomness used to blind the resulting encryption.

    Author:
    Eindhoven University of Technology (Meilof Veeningen)
